context: 'käisin' is the 1st person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'käima', which means 'to go', 'to visit', or 'to be somewhere'. It indicates that someone went to a place or visited a location in the past. The word 'käisime' would mean 'we went/visited', and 'käisid' would mean 'you (singular) went/visited'. This is one of the most frequently used verbs in Estonian for indicating movement to places.
